title: rustdoc: cannot resolve links to associated trait items for generic primitives

labels.name: T-rustdoc
labels.description: Relevant to the rustdoc team, which will review and decide on the PR/issue.

labels.name: A-intra-doc-links
labels.description: Area: Intra-doc links, the ability to link to items in docs by name

body:
As a continuation of https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/issues/90703

#92443 fixes this for "simple" primitives such as:
char, str, bool, never, usize, u{8, 16, 32, 64, 128}, isize, i{8, 16, 32, 64, 128} and f32, f64. However, for types that wrap around other types, such as Tuple, Array, Slice, RawPtr, etc. I was not able to make it work at first try. See the discussion here: https://github.com/rust-lang/rust/pull/92443#discussion_r776808181

Basically we want these comments to have links to the respective primitive type's implementation, e.g.:

``` rust
/// [`&[u32]::fmt()`] [`(u32, u32)::eq()`]
```

Should link to
- https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/primitive.slice.html#impl-Eq
- https://doc.rust-lang.org/std/primitive.tuple.html#impl-Debug-6

Note that for the tuple, we ideally want to link to the implementation for the specified size of the tuple.

Not sure if we also need to know whether the type inside the tuple actually has the necessary traits, e.g. in the case of `[(a, b)::fmt()]`, `a` and `b` should also have `Debug`. This is pretty complex and we might be able to get away without it.
